The 'Boost Hydropower' policy is the most capital-intensive, requiring an investment of around 65 billion USD.
The 'Constrain Hydropower' policy is the least capital-intensive at around 35 billion USD, but carries high emissions and energy security implications.
The 'Environment Priority' policy is more capital-intensive than 'Constrain Hydropower' but less than 'Boost Hydropower', costing around 60 billion USD.
